documentation.text: @notice Address of FactoryRegistry.sol
@notice Address of Protocol PoolFactory.sol
@notice Address of Voter.sol
@dev Represents Ether. Used by zapper to determine whether to return assets as ETH/WETH.
@notice Perform chained getAmountOut calculations on any number of pools

ETHER().details: Represents Ether. Used by zapper to determine whether to return assets as ETH/WETH.

UNSAFE_swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256[.notice: Swap one token for another without slippage protection

params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

returns._0: amounts     Array of amounts to swap  per route

addLiquidity(address,address,bool,uint25.notice: Add liquidity of two tokens to a Pool

params.amountADesired: Amount of tokenA desired to deposit
params.amountAMin: Minimum amount of tokenA to deposit
params.amountBDesired: Amount of tokenB desired to deposit
params.amountBMin: Minimum amount of tokenB to deposit
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

returns.amountA: Amount of tokenA to actually deposit
returns.amountB: Amount of tokenB to actually deposit
returns.liquidity: Amount of liquidity token returned from deposit

addLiquidityETH(address,bool,uint256,uin.notice: Add liquidity of a token and WETH (transferred as ETH) to a Pool

params.amountETHMin: Minimum amount of ETH to deposit
params.amountTokenDesired: Amount of token desired to deposit
params.amountTokenMin: Minimum amount of token to deposit
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

returns.amountETH: Amount of tokenETH to actually deposit
returns.amountToken: Amount of token to actually deposit
returns.liquidity: Amount of liquidity token returned from deposit

generateZapInParams(address,address,bool.details: Output token refers to the token you want to zap in from.
generateZapInParams(address,address,bool.notice: Used to generate params required for zapping in.         Zap in => remove liquidity then swap.         Apply slippage to expected swap values to account for changes in reserves in between.

params.amountInA: Amount of input token you wish to send down routesA
params.amountInB: Amount of input token you wish to send down routesB
params.routesA: Route used to convert input token to tokenA
params.routesB: Route used to convert input token to tokenB

returns.amountAMin: Minimum amount of tokenA expected from depositing liquidity.
returns.amountBMin: Minimum amount of tokenB expected from depositing liquidity.
returns.amountOutMinA: Minimum output expected from swapping input token to tokenA.
returns.amountOutMinB: Minimum output expected from swapping input token to tokenB.

generateZapOutParams(address,address,boo.details: Output token refers to the token you want to zap out of.
generateZapOutParams(address,address,boo.notice: Used to generate params required for zapping out.         Zap out => swap then add liquidity.         Apply slippage to expected liquidity values to account for changes in reserves in between.

params.liquidity: Amount of liquidity being zapped out of into a given output token.
params.routesA: Route used to convert tokenA into output token.
params.routesB: Route used to convert tokenB into output token.

returns.amountAMin: Minimum amount of tokenA expected from withdrawing liquidity.
returns.amountBMin: Minimum amount of tokenB expected from withdrawing liquidity.
returns.amountOutMinA: Minimum output expected from swapping tokenA into output token.
returns.amountOutMinB: Minimum output expected from swapping tokenB into output token.

getAmountsOut(uint256,(address,address,b.notice: Perform chained getAmountOut calculations on any number of pools

getReserves(address,address,bool,address.notice: Fetch and sort the reserves for a pool

params._factory: Address of PoolFactory for tokenA and tokenB
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

returns.reserveA: Amount of reserves of the sorted token A
returns.reserveB: Amount of reserves of the sorted token B

poolFor(address,address,bool,address).details: Returns a randomly generated address for a nonexistent pool
poolFor(address,address,bool,address).notice: Calculate the address of a pool by its' factory.         Used by all Router functions containing a `Route[]` or `_factory` argument.         Reverts if _factory is not approved by the FactoryRegistry

params._factory: Address of factory which created the pool
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

quoteAddLiquidity(address,address,bool,a.notice: Quote the amount deposited into a Pool

params._factory: Address of PoolFactory for tokenA and tokenB
params.amountADesired: Amount of tokenA desired to deposit
params.amountBDesired: Amount of tokenB desired to deposit
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

returns.amountA: Amount of tokenA to actually deposit
returns.amountB: Amount of tokenB to actually deposit
returns.liquidity: Amount of liquidity token returned from deposit

quoteRemoveLiquidity(address,address,boo.notice: Quote the amount of liquidity removed from a Pool

params._factory: Address of PoolFactory for tokenA and tokenB
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

quoteStableLiquidityRatio(address,addres.details: Returns stable liquidity ratio of B to (A + B).      E.g. if ratio is 0.4, it means there is more of A than there is of B.      Therefore you should deposit more of token A than B.
quoteStableLiquidityRatio(address,addres.notice: Used by zapper to determine appropriate ratio of A to B to deposit liquidity. Assumes stable pool.

params.tokenA: tokenA of stable pool you are zapping into.
params.tokenB: tokenB of stable pool you are zapping into.

returns.ratio: Ratio of token0 to token1 required to deposit into zap.

removeLiquidity(address,address,bool,uin.notice: Remove liquidity of two tokens from a Pool

params.amountAMin: Minimum amount of tokenA to receive
params.amountBMin: Minimum amount of tokenB to receive
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

removeLiquidityETH(address,bool,uint256,.notice: Remove liquidity of a token and WETH (returned as ETH) from a Pool

params.amountETHMin: Minimum amount of ETH to receive
params.amountTokenMin: Minimum amount of token to receive
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

removeLiquidityETHSupportingFeeOnTransfe.notice: Remove liquidity of a fee-on-transfer token and WETH (returned as ETH) from a Pool

params.amountETHMin: Minimum amount of ETH to receive
params.amountTokenMin: Minimum amount of token to receive
params.stable: True if pool is stable, false if volatile

sortTokens(address,address).notice: Sort two tokens by which address value is less than the other

returns.token0: Lower address value between tokenA and tokenB
returns.token1: Higher address value between tokenA and tokenB

params.amountOutMin: Minimum amount of desired token received
params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

returns.amounts: Array of amounts returned per route

swapExactETHForTokensSupportingFeeOnTran.notice: Swap ETH for a token supporting fee-on-transfer tokens

params.amountOutMin: Minimum amount of desired token received
params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

swapExactTokensForETH(uint256,uint256,(a.notice: Swap a token for WETH (returned as ETH)

params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

returns.amounts: Array of amounts returned per route

swapExactTokensForETHSupportingFeeOnTran.notice: Swap a token for WETH (returned as ETH) supporting fee-on-transfer tokens

params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

params.amountOutMin: Minimum amount of desired token received
params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

returns.amounts: Array of amounts returned per route

swapExactTokensForTokensSupportingFeeOnT.notice: Swap one token for another supporting fee-on-transfer tokens

params.amountOutMin: Minimum amount of desired token received
params.routes: Array of trade routes used in the swap

zapIn(address,uint256,uint256,(address,a.notice: Zap a token A into a pool (B, C). (A can be equal to B or C).         Supports standard ERC20 tokens only (i.e. not fee-on-transfer tokens etc).         Slippage is required for the initial swap.         Additional slippage may be required when adding liquidity as the         price of the token may have changed.

params.amountInA: Amount of input token you wish to send down routesA
params.amountInB: Amount of input token you wish to send down routesB
params.routesA: Route used to convert input token to tokenA
params.routesB: Route used to convert input token to tokenB
params.to: Address you wish to mint liquidity to.
params.tokenIn: Token you are zapping in from (i.e. input token).
params.zapInPool: Contains zap struct information. See Zap struct.

returns.liquidity: Amount of LP tokens created from zapping in.

zapOut(address,uint256,(address,address,.notice: Zap out a pool (B, C) into A.         Supports standard ERC20 tokens only (i.e. not fee-on-transfer tokens etc).         Slippage is required for the removal of liquidity.         Additional slippage may be required on the swap as the         price of the token may have changed.

params.liquidity: Amount of liquidity you wish to remove.
params.routesA: Route used to convert tokenA into output token.
params.routesB: Route used to convert tokenB into output token.
params.tokenOut: Token you are zapping out to (i.e. output token).
params.zapOutPool: Contains zap struct information. See Zap struct.
